channel.title: [BASICS] All In 1 [BASICS]
channel.description:
Hey Guys.. Today Im Making Some Tutorials About Exp Rates, Home Locations and Other stuff.. I know this is sooo easy.. but im just helping new people so they understand how all this works.
Knowledge Needed: Copying, Pasting, Reading, 0% or more experience at coding!
[size=x-large]How To Change Exp Rates![/size]
Open Your Source And Go To Config.java 317 Route: SRC > Server > Config Now This is the part where you are split. If You Want to change combat exp, Search For: [code]public static final int MELEE_EXP_RATE = [/code] And if you want to change Skill exp rate: [code] public static final int WOODCUTTING_EXPERIENCE = [/code] And Change The Numbers. NOTE: The higher, The Faster. The Lower, The Slower!
[size=x-large]How To Change Your Home Location & Spawn Location![/size] So Once Again, We Are Going To Open Config.Java 317 Route: SRC > Server > Config So Now Look For Your Current Home Teleport Coords.. E.G. [code]3333, 1231[/code] ^ Made it up. Now Just Change the coords to different coords and thats your Home Teleport Done! Now For Your Respawn Location, You Should Find Something LIKE this: [code]public static final int RESPAWN_X = 2755; // when dead respawn here public static final int RESPAWN_Y = 2764;[/code] Something like that.. and just change the coords.. ;) Moving On!
[size=x-large]How To Change Some Tab Info![/size] First of all, go to clickingbuttons.java 317 Route: And Now You Should Stumble Across Loads Of Info! Now Say In my Quest Tab It said, "Owner Is RawR" And i wanted to change it, i would do ctrl+f and search for that, then change it. So Thats How You Change Stuff In Your Tabs! [font=arial black][size=24pt] MOVED WEBCLIENT TUTORIAL TO:[/size][/font] [size=36pt]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,562565.msg4101616.html#msg4101616[/size] [size=x-large]NOTIFICATION: More Tutorials Added Below, Check Them Out![/size]
[font=arial black][size=18pt]How To Edit Yell For Specific People (very Easy)[/size][/font] So For This Tutorial, I will show you how to edit/make yell tags for SPECIFIC people. First Of All, You're Gonna Want To Open Up Source>Src>server>model>players>packets>Commands.java (because they use ::yell to yell so thats where we are heading for) After You Have Opened That Up.. You Should Search For The Following: [code]If (playerCommand.startsWith("yell"))[/code] After That; Scroll down and find something like: [code]if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Jack")) { c2.sendMessage("<shad=9440238>[System Coder And Developer]</col><img=1>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +"");[/code] And Thats What The Yell Tag For Jack is.. If We Wanted Micheal To Be A Developer.. We Would Change The Part: "Jack")) To: "Micheal")) And The: [System Coder And Developer] To: [Developer] If We Wanted To ADD One, We Would Simply Copy The Above One And Paste It Below, Or If You're More Skilled, Write It Out Yourself, Try And See If you get no errors! Thanks For Viewing This TuT!
[font=arial black]Changing Shop items![/font] I Know For SOME People Changing Shop Items Is A Pain In The Ass, So That Is Why, I Will Teach You: How To Change Shop Items. First Of All.. Open Up Shops.CFG! Search For The Item Id You Are TRYING to change, E.G. If i had Dclaws in "aubury's_Magic_Shop" I Would Look For 14484 and Change It To W/e.. WARNING: NEVER PUT MONEY IN THE SHOP! So That is How You Change One Item In A Shop To Another, Remember: Compile After! If You Want More Of The Item, Change the amount E.G. "100" To "1000" So There is "1000" of that item! GOOD LUCK! ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Will Add More TUTS SOON!
[font=Arial][size=x-large]Credits:[/size][/font]
Me - Writing, pics, my knowledge and shit You Guys - For Reading.. ;) *ask for more if you need them*
Thanks For Viewing and GL!

item.title: [BASICS] All In 1 [BASICS]
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I understand what thread-per-client is, I’ve used it before. I just didn’t know it wasn’t supported.

Read full topic

item.title: [BASICS] All In 1 [BASICS]
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

l0l. No. Thread-per-client is incredibly unscalable. No one likes 100s of threads for a single process.

Example of tpc: (Note this is NOT from any WinterLove base server)

new Thread() {
    @Override
    public void run() {
        try {
            int packetId = -1;
            while ((packetId = clientSocket.getInputStream().read()) >= 0) {
                  byte[] payload = new byte[256];
		  clientSocket.getInputStream().read(payload);
	     }
        } catch (IOException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}.start();

You’re creating a new thread for every new client that is connected.

Read full topic

item.title: [BASICS] All In 1 [BASICS]
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:35, topic:455421”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=558321.msg4101650#msg4101650 date=1347566670]

RandQm: Oracle has some nice NIO networking tutorials, the OP is too stupid to know what that even means.

My limited English knowledge isn’t able to understand parts of oracle docs.
My limited java knowledge isn’t able to apply the knowledge about networking into an rsps.

Well also on top of that, iirc, you use Delta as your base of choice. That using wL’s networking, which if it’s close to PI’s, could be quite the challenge, since everything is handled in that class (process, init’s, etc. etc.), If I were you, I’d mess around with one of Graham’s frameworks, Apollo uses Netty and I believe Hyperion uses MINA, so try changing those to NIO. What I did to start learning networking is write a simple client-server program, but mine was just using the standard networking at the time.
[/quote]

You mean Java IO? And, PI uses MINA, which in design is not close to IO.[/quote]
wL uses Java IO? I thought it used MINA too… My bad.

Read full topic
